code:
def analyze_object(obj):
    # Display the attributes and methods of an object
    attributes = dir(obj)
    print(f"The object has the following attributes and methods: {attributes}")

    # Check if the object is callable
    if callable(obj):
        print(f"The object {obj} is callable.")
    else:
        print(f"The object {obj} is not callable.")

    # Count the number of public methods
    public_methods = [method for method in attributes if callable(getattr(obj, method)) and not method.startswith('_')]
    print(f"The object has {len(public_methods)} public methods.")

class IntrospectionDemo:
    def __init__(self, name):
        self.name = name

    def greet(self):
        print(f"Hello, my name is {self.name}.")

# Create an instance of IntrospectionDemo
demo_object = IntrospectionDemo("Alice")

# Analyze the demo_object using our function
analyze_object(demo_object)

# Introduce an error by trying to call a non-existing method
demo_object.fly()
